thread.title: VirtualQube Warns Small Businesses about the Risks of Using End-of-Support Software, Inviting Them to Complimentary Webinar September 25, 2015
thread.title_full: VirtualQube Warns Small Businesses about the Risks of Using End-of-Support Software, Inviting Them to Complimentary Webinar September 25, 2015 - CBS News 8 - San Diego, CA News Station - KFMB Channel 8

author: cbs8
title: VirtualQube Warns Small Businesses about the Risks of Using End-of-Support Software, Inviting Them to Complimentary Webinar September 25, 2015
text:
Managed IT services firm offering free Unsupported & Unsecure Software Audit to those businesses attending 60-minute live presentation outlining the true costs of outdated systems
SEATTLE, Wash.
VirtualQube, a provider of managed IT services and a stable, secure and scalable cloud solution for small and medium businesses throughout the Greater Seattle area, today announced it’s presenting a webinar later this month to inform companies about the serious dangers and recovery costs from not updating business software systems. The presentation entitled “The True Cost of Using End-of-Life Software” will explore whether or not it’s worth the risk of not migrating to new versions of operating systems and other business software when they become obsolete. The webinar is set for Friday, September 25, 2015.
“Being comfortable with the software you use to run your business is important,” said Scott Gorcester, CEO, VirtualQube. “Most businesses stick with what’s comfortable and avoid the expense of updating systems. We can take a good look at the software being used now, then help businesses assess their level of comfort and the possible risks and costs.”
According to research group IDC, there’s a 60% chance business computers will be infected with a virus using unsupported software. Other risks include compliance penalties, revenue loss and downtime. VirtualQube’s free webinar and complimentary audit will help participants learn where they stand with their operating systems, such as Windows XP and Windows Server 2003, and other business software.
To learn more about VirtualQube and how to join its free webinar, please visit http://www.virtualqube.com or call 425.939.2700.
About VirtualQube
VirtualQube is a managed IT service provider (MSP) based near Seattle, Washington. The MSP offers first-class IT support and consulting to small and medium businesses in many industries, including aviation, transportation and shipping. Some of the company’s IT services include increased security, data and backup recovery, cloud computing management, email encryption, desktop management, network and server management, firewall management, IT consulting, IT strategy planning, server backups, desktop encryption, Virtual CIO, and more. For more information about VirtualQube and its IT support solutions, visit the company on the web at http://www.virtualqube.com . To learn more now, call 425.939.2700. Also, to get the latest industry news and trends, go to http://www.virtualqube.com/blog/ .
